TopicTitle: show me what you are building or have build in 0.90

Articles.Content:
I'm on my work and i want to start building something so bad.

i have to wait to 22:00.

so guys show me what you are building' or have build in 0.90 and inspire me.

If i really like it and you like me to, ill showcase it on my youtube channel.

Greetings

Reaper

Ps ill post when i'm home

I'm doing career mode, so I haven't built much. Turns out making the buildings upgradeable was a great way to slow your early game down. On .25 I was in orbit by my second rocket. Now that I was limited to 30 parts until I got the VAB upgraded, and 18T until I got the launch pad upgraded, it took me many more flights than that before I could get into orbit. That feels limiting to a KSP veteran, but for a new player that's figuring out how to build and fly basic rockets, it's a really good mechanic that will force them to learn how to build efficiently before they blow hundreds of thousands on a moar boosters inefficient rocket.

Thus far I've managed to orbit the mun and return before I had to go to bed - itself a really good accomplishment considering I haven't upgraded tracking yet and am used to the map showing me intercepts, which it doesn't on the base building.

This update has added quite a bit of challenge to the early game!

Nice.

i'm planning to start my first career en make a serie's on how ill learn to build rockets.

i normaly build planes

I had the greatest idea to rebuild the Eagle shuttle. The new fuselage is ....! Same cargo bay dimensions, and it looks a gazillion times better. Plus, it's a fraction of the parts to do it.

Edited December 17, 2014 by xaphan6669

This is a shuttle I'm working on using KW Rocketry.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

If I may, how does it land?
Carefully. There's a Mk16-XL and two radial mount chutes on the nose. Usually pick a flat landing site, deploy the chutes, and using the remainder of the fuel, gently set it down on its engines, whilst using RCS to keep it stable.

I'm doing career mode, so I haven't built much. Turns out making the buildings upgradeable was a great way to slow your early game down. On .25 I was in orbit by my second rocket. Now that I was limited to 30 parts until I got the VAB upgraded, and 18T until I got the launch pad upgraded, it took me many more flights than that before I could get into orbit. That feels limiting to a KSP veteran, but for a new player that's figuring out how to build and fly basic rockets, it's a really good mechanic that will force them to learn how to build efficiently before they blow hundreds of thousands on a moar boosters inefficient rocket.

Thus far I've managed to orbit the mun and return before I had to go to bed - itself a really good accomplishment considering I haven't upgraded tracking yet and am used to the map showing me intercepts, which it doesn't on the base building.

This update has added quite a bit of challenge to the early game!

That's odd, I was still able to reach orbit with my second launch, though I couldn't do an EVA. Perhaps you were using unconventional methods to get into orbit? I just used a simple 2-stage launcher.
